pullRequest.title: Add support for showing view definition in BigQuery

afterCommit.message: Add support for showing view definition in BigQuery

nodes.bodyText: Is the second call to viewDefinition.getQuery() needed?

beforeCommit.message: Add support for showing view definition in BigQuery

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -161,6 +161,12 @@ BigQuery       Trino                        Notes
 ``TIMESTAMP``  ``TIMESTAMP_WITH_TIME_ZONE`` Time zone is UTC
 =============  ============================ =============================================================================================================
 
+System Tables
+-------------
+
+The connector supports queries of the view definition. Given a view ``customer_view``,
+``SELECT * customer_view$big_query_views`` shows the view definition.

nodes.bodyText: This abstraction seems unnecessary. There's only one type of handler, and it's not clear that future ones would use the same suffix matching logic. If and when we need to add others, we can refactor the code to use a generic enum if appropriate.
Is the name viewName accurate? That represents something like customer_view$big_query_views, no? In that case, it would be the "view definition table name", not the actual view name.
nit: move as private method to BigQueryMetadata.java?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The connector supports queries of the view definition. Given a view ``customer_view``,
          
          
            
            ``SELECT * customer_view$view_definition`` shows the view definition.
          
          
            
            For each Trino table which maps to BigQuery view there exists a system table which exposes BigQuery view definition.
          
          
            
            Given a BigQuery view ``customer_view`` you can send query
          
          
            
            ``SELECT * customer_view$view_definition`` to see the SQL which defines view in BigQuery.
